[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Panic vulnerability] Can an attacker cause a validator node crash by configuring ApiConfig with tls_cert_path=Some() but tls_key_path=None, triggering the unsafe unwrap() at line 46 causing node unavailability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Path traversal] Can an attacker exploit tls_cert_path or tls_key_path by providing paths like '../../../../etc/passwd' to read arbitrary files from the validator filesystem, potentially exposing private keys or validator credentials? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Certificate validation bypass] Does the TLS configuration at lines 43-46 validate that the certificate and private key match, or can an attacker provide mismatched cert/key pairs causing TLS handshake failures and validator API unavailability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Weak TLS configuration] Does warp's tls() method at line 44 enforce strong cipher suites and TLS 1.3, or can downgrade attacks force validators to use weak ciphers enabling man-in-the-middle attacks on validator communication? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Certificate expiration] Is there validation that TLS certificates are not expired before starting the server, or can expired certificates cause runtime failures after node startup leading to validator API unavailability? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Missing certificate revocation checks] Does the TLS setup verify certificate revocation lists (CRL) or OCSP, or can compromised certificates continue to be accepted allowing unauthorized access to validator APIs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: new()] [Unvalidated TLS paths] Can an attacker provide symbolic links as tls_cert_path/tls_key_path in the constructor at lines 23-32 to point to attacker-controlled files or sockets, enabling arbitrary code execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Race condition in file loading] Between server construction and serve() invocation, can an attacker replace certificate/key files causing time-of-check-time-of-use vulnerabilities leading to unauthorized certificate usage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [File descriptor exhaustion] If tls_cert_path or tls_key_path point to special files like /dev/urandom, can this exhaust file descriptors or cause infinite reads leading to validator node DoS? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [TLS renegotiation attacks] Does the TLS configuration prevent client-initiated renegotiation attacks that could be used to exhaust validator CPU resources affecting consensus participation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Struct: WebServer] [Unrestricted binding] Can the address field at line 11 be set to 0.0.0.0:8080 without validation, exposing internal validator APIs to the public internet and enabling unauthorized access to sensitive blockchain data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: new()] [No address validation] Does the constructor at lines 23-32 validate that SocketAddr does not bind to privileged ports (<1024) without proper permissions, potentially causing bind failures and validator unavailability? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Port conflict] If another process is already bound to self.address at lines 41 or 47, does bind() fail silently allowing the validator to believe APIs are running when they are not, causing validator exclusion from consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: new()] [IPv6 dual-stack confusion] Can ambiguous SocketAddr configurations (e.g., [::]:8080 vs 0.0.0.0:8080) cause validators to listen on unintended network interfaces exposing APIs to untrusted networks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [No interface binding validation] Does the implementation prevent binding to localhost-only addresses (127.0.0.1) when validators need external reachability, causing network partition and loss of liveness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Bind race condition] Can multiple serve() calls on the same WebServer instance cause race conditions in port binding, leading to undefined behavior or validator API unavailability? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Unvalidated routes] The generic Filter parameter at line 37 accepts any routes without validation - can an attacker inject routes that bypass authentication, expose internal APIs, or serve malicious content? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [No route authentication] Does serve() enforce that all routes include authentication middleware, or can routes be served without access control allowing unauthorized blockchain state queries or transaction submission? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Missing rate limiting] Is there rate limiting on the routes passed to serve(), or can attackers flood validator APIs with requests causing resource exhaustion and consensus performance degradation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [No request size limits] Are there limits on request body sizes, or can attackers send gigabyte-sized requests causing memory exhaustion and validator node crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Missing timeout configuration] Does the server enforce connection and request timeouts, or can slowloris attacks keep connections open indefinitely exhausting validator resources? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [No connection limits] Is there a maximum concurrent connection limit, or can attackers open thousands of connections causing file descriptor exhaustion and validator API unavailability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Missing CORS validation] If routes include CORS headers allowing any origin, can malicious websites make cross-origin requests to validator APIs enabling phishing or credential theft attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [No content-type validation] Are incoming request content-types validated, or can attackers send polyglot payloads that bypass input validation causing injection vulnerabilities in downstream handlers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve()] [Unwrap panic] The unwrap() call at line 46 for tls_key_path will panic if tls_key_path is None despite tls_cert_path being Some - can this be triggered through malformed ApiConfig causing validator crash? (High)
